page.title: 13SOUTH LEITH PARISH
page.content: Founded in 1483, it was where education began in Leith. From this Leith Academy emerged and from 1560, the Kirk Session was responsible for it. The Church now has a roll of about 1900 and is adapting and changing to meet the needs of the present community. {LEITH ACADEMY Records from 1560 show that under various names it has occupied several sites. In 1806, 1898 and again in 1931 new buildings were needed as the old ones were inadequate. For the past 20years the people of Leith have been fighting for a new school for their children. The tree buildings used at present are old, in need of repair and ill equipped.
